original: NORDENHAAG, Herbert Petrus, Direktör, Västerås, f Kristineh 27/3 93 av köpm P N o Augusta Lalin, gm Karin Johansson. Realex Krhn, Schartaus, Hsands skogs- o sågv.sk. Anst i fad manuf.aff Krhn 08—16, kont.ch AB C W Johanssons träv.aff Etuna 18—26, vkst dir där 34—36, övert Gust Laurells träv.-aff V.ås 28, omb denna t H Nordenhaag» täv.aff AB 39. Styr.led AB C W Johanssons träv.aff o AB Kvicksunds tegelbr i Etuna, Sv träv.handl:s centralfrb (STC), ordf Västml trä- o byggn.varufrn. Resor: Norge, Danm, Tyskl, Belg, Holl, Engl, Frankr, Schweiz, Österr, Ung, Ital T öl tillf 12—39. Västml Isfe-frbs SM. Hobby: Jakt.
translated: NORDENHAAG, Herbert Petrus, Director, Västerås, born in Kristinehamn on March 27th, 1893, son of merchant P.N. and Augusta Lalin, married to Karin Johansson. Completed secondary school at Krhn, attended Schartaus, and worked in the forestry and sawmill industry. Employed at his father's manufacturing company from 1908 to 1916, then as an accountant at AB C.W. Johansson's timber company in Etuna from 1918 to 1926. Became the company's Deputy Director from 1934 to 1936, then took over Gust Laurell's timber company in Västerås in 1928 and renamed it H. Nordenhaag's timber company AB in 1939. He served on the board of AB C.W. Johansson's timber company, AB Kvicksunds brickworks in Etuna, and the Central Association of Swedish Timber Trade (STC). He was also the chairman of the Westmanland Timber and Building Materials Association. He traveled to Norway, Denmark, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands, England, France, Switzerland, Austria, Hungary, and Italy for business purposes between 1912 and 1939. He was a participant in the Westmanland Ice Skating Association's National Championships. His hobby was hunting.
